answers.answer: Hi!I am sorry to hear about your mother. Various reasons for recurrent or persisting fungal infection are incomplete treatment, treatment resistance, co-existing diabetes and low immunity. A combination of antifungals will have to be tried and her immunity boosted with diet and therapy. Along with that diabetes, HIV, liver and kidney status needs to be checked. Hope this helps. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. question: I will try and make this as short as I can. In October my mother contracted Fungal Meningitis. She had spent months in the hospital getting IV ampho b and voreconsale. During this struggle she was diagnosed with Arachnoiditis as well as two abscesses located on her spine. Her treatments aren't working, it's been 8 months and she's in worse condition than she started. I'm reaching out to the medical community to find her a specialist, THE specialist in fungal infections. Someone who can help her. I would appreciate any recommendations anyone has.
title: Fungal Meningitis Specialist
